newsitem.title: INDIA: India's HCL tenders for 30,000 T copper cathodes.
newsitem.headline: India's HCL tenders for 30,000 T copper cathodes.

text.p: India's copper monopoly Hindustan Copper Ltd (HCL) said on Tuesday that it has tendered for the import of 30,000 tonnes of "A" grade copper cathodes.
The tender document said offers should reach HCL's headquarters in Calcutta by 0900 GMT on November 5, and would be opened the same day.
The material should be London Metal Exchange-registered grade "A" copper in the form of electrolytic cathodes/Solvent Extraction Electrowon Cathodes, the statement said.

It said shipments were to be made in lots ranging from 2,000 to 5,000 tonnes at HCL's option from January to November 1997. The exact schedule of shipments would be finalised before signing of contracts.
The statement said the delivery of cathodes would be CIF Bombay port through conference liner vessels only.
